Definition.WordDefinition: WITTICISM, n. A sharp and clever remark, usually quoted, and seldom noted; what the Philistine is pleased to call a "joke."

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Witticism \Wit"ti*cism\, n. [From {Witty}.] A witty saying; a sentence or phrase which is affectedly witty; an attempt at wit; a conceit. --Milton. [1913 Webster]
He is full of conceptions, points of epigram, and witticisms; all which are below the dignity of heroic verse. --Addison. [1913 Webster]
witticism n : a message whose ingenuity or verbal skill or incongruity has the power to evoke laughter [syn: {wit}, {humor}, {humour}, {wittiness}]
